info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 3:05PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN HUNTINGDON... CENTRAL BLAIR AND NORTHEASTERN CAMBRIA COUNTIES THROUGH 345 PM EDT... At 305 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Tyrone, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Altoona, Huntingdon, Tyrone, Lakemont, Bellwood, Williamsburg, Tipton, Blandburg, Spruce Creek, Sinking Valley, Canoe Creek State Park, Royer, McConnellstown, Alexandria, Marklesburg, Peoples Natural Gas Field, Penn State Altoona, Delgrosso`s Amusement Park and Lakemont Park And Island Waterpark. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for central Pennsylvania.
